skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material consisting of pigment or dye bound in an emulsion of acrylic resin.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material consisting of pigment or dye bound in an emulsion of acrylic resin.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material consisting of fine-grained limestone, or a soft, earthy form of calcium carbonate.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material consisting of fine-grained limestone, or a soft, earthy form of calcium carbonate.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material consisting of the dark grey residue made of carbon, and any remaining ash, obtained by removing water and other volatile constituents from animal and plant substances.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material consisting of the dark grey residue made of carbon, and any remaining ash, obtained by removing water and other volatile constituents from animal and plant substances.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material consisting of a coloured substance dissolved or suspended in a liquid that can be absorbed by the base material.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material consisting of a coloured substance dissolved or suspended in a liquid that can be absorbed by the base material.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material consisting of pigment and a binding agent, and sometimes added inert materials, to form an opaque, coloured, water-soluble paint. Includes poster paints. The term originally referred to the technique of oil paint applied on top of tempera.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material consisting of pigment and a binding agent, and sometimes added inert materials, to form an opaque, coloured, water-soluble paint. Includes poster paints. The term originally referred to the technique of oil paint applied on top of tempera.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material consisting of a naturally occurring allotrope of carbon which is opaque, soft, greasy to the touch, and iron black to steel gray in color. It is used in the form of powder, sticks, or in pencils.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material consisting of a naturally occurring allotrope of carbon which is opaque, soft, greasy to the touch, and iron black to steel gray in color. It is used in the form of powder, sticks, or in pencils.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material consisting of pigment or dye contained in a liquid or paste.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material consisting of pigment or dye contained in a liquid or paste.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material generally used as a finish that may be clear or coloured, consisting of polymers or acrylic compounds dissolved in volatile organic compounds or other solvents, that when dry is a hard and durable material.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material generally used as a finish that may be clear or coloured, consisting of polymers or acrylic compounds dissolved in volatile organic compounds or other solvents, that when dry is a hard and durable material.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material that is a natural or synthetic inorganic compound consisting of particles that are highly magnetic and are commonly used to store binary or analog information.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material that is a natural or synthetic inorganic compound consisting of particles that are highly magnetic and are commonly used to store binary or analog information.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material consisting of multiple materials known to have been applied, but not all can be readily identified.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material consisting of multiple materials known to have been applied, but not all can be readily identified.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material consisting of pigment suspended in a drying oil.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material consisting of pigment suspended in a drying oil.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material consisting of pigment mixed with a binder, usually in the form of a stick.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material consisting of pigment mixed with a binder, usually in the form of a stick.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material or base material consisting of a powder prepared from calcium sulphate dihydrate (gypsum) or calcium carbonate and mixed with water and sometimes a filler to form a paste that liberates heat and then hardens.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material or base material consisting of a powder prepared from calcium sulphate dihydrate (gypsum) or calcium carbonate and mixed with water and sometimes a filler to form a paste that liberates heat and then hardens.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material or base material consisting of synthetic or semi-synthetic organic polymers of high molecular weight that are moldable.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material or base material consisting of synthetic or semi-synthetic organic polymers of high molecular weight that are moldable.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material consisting of pigment mixed with a water-soluble binder medium, usually a glutinous material such as egg yolk or some other size, to form a permanent fast-drying painting medium.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material consisting of pigment mixed with a water-soluble binder medium, usually a glutinous material such as egg yolk or some other size, to form a permanent fast-drying painting medium.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material consisting of pigment suspended in water to form a transparent painting medium.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material consisting of pigment suspended in water to form a transparent painting medium.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: An applied material or a base material consisting of a chemical compound from an animal, plant, mineral, or synthetic source that is malleable near ambient temperatures, slightly greasy to the touch, with a low melting point, and usually translucent, water-repellant, and soluble in organic solvents.
skos:Concept.rdakit:toolkitDefinition: An applied material or a base material consisting of a chemical compound from an animal, plant, mineral, or synthetic source that is malleable near ambient temperatures, slightly greasy to the touch, with a low melting point, and usually translucent, water-repellant, and soluble in organic solvents.
